definition: agreeing with one another/congenial
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
to share vile habits/partners in notoriety/birds of a feather
congenial

sentences.english: I met few people congenial to me in the department.
sentences.chinese: 在那个单位里我没碰到几个意气相投的人。

sentences.english: He liked most animals stamps, he likes to make friends with like-minded friends.
sentences.chinese: 他最喜欢动物邮票，他喜欢结交情趣相投朋友。

sentences.english: You should choose a roommate more compatible to your tastes.
sentences.chinese: 你应该挑个和你意气更相投的人同住一室。

sentences.english: Some like-minded people got together and set up a group.
sentences.chinese: 一些志趣相投的人聚在一起，成立了一个小组。
友情是知趣相投的共享。

sentences.english: Too often, however, collegiality is confused with congeniality (Berth, 1986).
sentences.chinese: 但是很多人常把联合领导和意气相投混淆。

sentences.english: Because congenial delight, he and a similar age man become true friendship.
sentences.chinese: 因情趣相投，他和一个年纪相仿的男人成为莫逆之交。

sentences.english: In this small village, he find few persons congenial to him.
sentences.chinese: 在这座小村庄中，他发现没几个人跟他意气相投。

sentences.english: They were glad to find out that they spoke the same language and soon became buddy-buddy .
sentences.chinese: 他们很高兴地发现双方志趣相投，很快变得亲密无间。

sentences.english: Like people like to spend time with like people.
sentences.chinese: 人们通常喜欢与志趣相投的人呆在一起。

sentences.english: Antonio Cassano says he's found some like-minded characters in the AC Milan locker room.
sentences.chinese: 卡萨诺在米兰更衣室内找到了些志气相投地分子。

sentences.english: What, with the largest portion of your mind -- sentiments -- tastes?
sentences.chinese: 我们想法一致，观点相合，总之大家意气相投。

sentences.english: Because, in the first place, we and him are like-minded and share the same ideas !
sentences.chinese: 那是因为我们和他见解略同，志趣相投。

sentences.english: I only let people in who vibe with me.
sentences.chinese: 我只接纳与我意气相投的人。

sentences.english: Brainstorm with a group of like-minded writers.
sentences.chinese: 与一群智取相投的作家一起做头脑风暴。

sentences.english: What worries me is that this may result in an audience of like-minded readers.
sentences.chinese: 让我担忧的是这可能导致出现一群志趣相投的读者。

definition: congenial
to get along well (with sb)/congenial/to speculate (on financial markets)
to share vile habits/partners in notoriety/birds of a feather
to be able to talk to/to get along with/to be congenial
to be kindred spirits/to hit it off
to get along well/compatible/also written 和得來|和得来[he2 de5 lai2]
familiarity at first sight
to have an affinity with each other (idiom)/to find each other congenial
to go well together/to be compatible/to cater to/to please
like-minded (idiom)/fellow enthusiast/kindred spirit
inclination/interest
intimate friendship/bosom buddies
to make friends with
to know oneself/to be intimate or close/intimate friend
very friendly/intimate
to not conform to/to be unsuited to/to be out of keeping with/should not/ought out
